definition: self/oneself/sixth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/sixth in order/letter "F" or Roman "VI" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/hexa
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: The great question ahead for Microsoft is how to engage with a participative and opinionated community like this.
sentences.chinese: 微軟首要的問題是對這類社區的干涉和固執己見。

sentences.english: Stubbornness is like a wall that you set up between you and your mate.
sentences.chinese: 固執己見就好像一道牆築在你跟配偶中間。

sentences.english: But its thinking remained stubbornly the same.
sentences.chinese: 但那時，北約仍是固執己見。

sentences.english: "No family needs two dogs, "I began dogmatically.
sentences.chinese: 我先是固執己見地說道，“沒有人家需要兩隻狗的。

sentences.english: The differences between the two parties won't be healed as they insist on their own terms.
sentences.chinese: 由於雙方固執己見，他們之間的分歧將無法予以排解。

sentences.english: Perhaps you are too dogmatic with certain things.
sentences.chinese: 也許你對某些問題過於固執己見。

sentences.english: Whether Ireland will get its way remains to be seen.
sentences.chinese: 愛爾蘭是否會固執己見，仍有待觀察。

definition: flippant and insincere (piece of writing or speech)/glib-tongued/oily
scholars tend to disparage one another (idiom)
lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/nitpicking/overcritical

lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/to remark upon a person's appearance/nitpicking/overcritical/judgmental
not recognizing one's family (idiom); self-centered and not making any allowances for the needs of one's relatives
(idiom) to freely air one's views/to be heard far and wide/to attract a lot of attention
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
